abstract: With the sale of the energy-trading unit to Occidental, Citigroup could potentially avoid controversy over the compensation of Andrew J. Hall, who ran the firm.
snippet: With the sale of the energy-trading unit to Occidental, Citigroup could potentially avoid controversy over the compensation of Andrew J. Hall, who ran the firm.
lead_paragraph: Citigroup is letting go of its $100 million man, Andrew J. Hall, and the lucrative energy trading business he ran, after Washington’s special compensation master threatened a public showdown over his nine-figure bonus.

headline.main: Citigroup Sheds Energy Unit and Its $100 Million Trader
headline.print_headline: Citi Averts Clash Over Huge Bonus

byline.original: By Eric Dash and Jack Healy
